clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Amino Acids and Sugar Alcohols on Gastric Emptying and Release of Satiation Peptides in Humans
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Amino Acids and Sugar Alcohols on Gastric Emptying and Release of Satiation Peptides in Normal Weight and Obese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: With this study the investigators investigate the effects of amino acids (tryptophan in two different concentrations, leucin) and sugar alcohols (xylitol, erythritol) on satiety mechanisms.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of insulin are measured

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of glucagon are measured

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of glucagon-like Peptide (GLP-1) are measured

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of PYY are measured

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on secretion of satiation hormones
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to three hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of cholecystokinin are measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of different aminoacids and sugar alcohols on gastric emptying
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline to four hours after treatment

arm_group.description: 0.52 g L-Tryptophan in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
1.56 g L-Tryptophan in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
1.56 g L-Leucine in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
50 g Xylitol in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
75 g Erythritol in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
75 g Glucose in 300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube
300 mL tap water (plus 50 mg 13C-sodium acetate) given via nasogastric tube

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy normal weight subjects with a body-mass index of 19.0-24.9
- Healthy obese subjects with a body-mass index of > 30
- Normal eating habits (no diets; no dietary changes; no special dietary habits, such as vegetarian/vegan)
- Age 18-40 years
- Stable body weight for at least three months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Substance abuse
- Regular intake of medications (except for oral contraceptives)
- Medical or psychiatric illness
- History of gastrointestinal disorders
- Food allergies
- Pregnancy, breast feeding

facility.name: University Hospital Basel, Phase 1 Research Unit
